Catch pre-screening of 'Hunger Games' movie

Fans of the Hunger Games trilogy and Louisville's Jennifer Lawrence have the opportunity Wednesday Nov 19 to take in a special pre-screening of the The Hunger Games: Mockingjay-Part One before it opens nationwide.

Catch pre-screening of 'Hunger Games' movie

Kirby Adams, The Courier-Journal 2:14 p.m. EST November 11, 2014

This is Presudent Snow's Panem Address - "Together as One. Released June 25, 2014.

Jennifer Lawrence in The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 1 (Photo: Provided )

Fans of the "Hunger Games" trilogy and Louisville's Jennifer Lawrence have the opportunity Nov. 19 to take in a special pre-screening of the "The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 1" before it opens nationwide.

The screening will be hosted by the Lawrence Foundation (yes, THAT, Lawrence) and the Community Foundation of Louisville to benefit the Boys & Girls Clubs of Kentuckiana. Individual tickets are $125. A limited number will be sold. Packages are also available. All tickets can be purchased online at https://cflfund.net/netcommunity/mockingjay.

Doors open at 6 p.m., with the film screening at 7 p.m., at Cinemark Tinseltown USA, 4400 Towne Center Drive.

Movies & TV: More entertainment news and reviews

If you go, you are encouraged to dress as your favorite "Hunger Games" character for the chance to be named "Best Dressed" and win an autographed poster.

Jennifer Lawrence has covered the costs of this special screening so that all proceeds will directly benefit Boys & Girls Clubs of Kentuckiana.

The all-star cast of 'The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1', including Jennifer Lawrence and Josh Hutcherson, hit the red carpet to promote its world premiere in London. Rough cut (no reporter narration).

Karen Lawrence, Jennifer's mother, and other family and friends will be in attendance. The Buzz has been told that Jennifer will not be attending.

Have an idea for The Buzz? Send it to Kirby Adams at kadams@courier-journal.com.
